title: Shakshuka (Middle Eastern Poached Eggs)
ingredients:
2 eggs,
1 tablespoon olive oil,
1/2 onion chopped,
1 garlic clove minced,
1/2 bell pepper chopped,
2 tomatoes chopped (or 1/2 cup canned tomatoes),
salt and pepper to taste,
a pinch of paprika or cumin (optional),
fresh parsley (optional).
instructions:
1. Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat.
2. Sauté onion and garlic until soft.
3. Add bell pepper and cook until tender.
4. Stir in tomatoes, paprika/cumin, salt, and pepper. Simmer for 5-7 minutes.
5. Make small wells and crack eggs into them.
6. Cover and cook until eggs are set to your liking.
7. Garnish with parsley and serve with bread.

title: Roti Telur (Malaysian Egg Flatbread)
ingredients:
1 roti canai or plain paratha (frozen ok),
1 egg,
1 tablespoon chopped onion,
salt and pepper to taste,
oil or butter for frying.
instructions:
1. Thaw roti if frozen.
2. Beat egg with onion, salt, and pepper.
3. Heat a little oil/butter in a pan.
4. Pour egg mixture and immediately place roti over it.
5. Cook until egg sets and flip to crisp the other side.
6. Serve hot with chili sauce or curry.

title: French Toast (Pain Perdu)
ingredients:
2 slices of bread,
1 egg,
1/4 cup milk,
1 teaspoon sugar,
a pinch of cinnamon (optional),
butter for frying,
syrup or powdered sugar for serving.
instructions:
1. Beat egg, milk, sugar, and cinnamon together.
2. Dip bread slices into the mixture, coating both sides.
3. Melt butter in a pan over medium heat.
4. Cook bread until golden brown on both sides.
5. Serve warm with syrup or powdered sugar.

title: Tamagoyaki (Japanese Rolled Omelette)
ingredients:
3 eggs,
1 tablespoon sugar,
1 teaspoon soy sauce,
a pinch of salt,
oil for cooking.
instructions:
1. Beat eggs with sugar, soy sauce, mirin, and salt until combined.
2. Heat a lightly oiled pan over medium heat.
3. Pour a thin layer of egg mixture and cook until half set.
4. Roll the omelette to one side.
5. Add more egg mixture, lifting the roll so the new layer flows underneath.
6. When half cooked, roll again with the previous roll.
7. Repeat until all egg mixture is used.
8. Slice and serve hot or cold.

title: Simple Fried Rice
ingredients:
2 plates of cooked white rice,
2 cloves garlic minced,
1 egg,
2 tablespoons sweet soy sauce,
1 teaspoon oyster sauce (optional),
salt and pepper to taste,
2 tablespoons cooking oil.
instructions:
1. Heat oil and sauté garlic until fragrant.
2. Add egg and scramble until cooked.
3. Add rice and mix well.
4. Add soy sauce, oyster sauce, salt, and pepper. Stir until flavors are absorbed.
5. Serve hot with your favorite toppings.

title: Onigiri (Japanese Rice Ball)
ingredients:
2 cups cooked rice,
1 teaspoon salt,
2 sheets nori (cut to size),
fillings (canned tuna + mayo, grilled salmon, or umeboshi).
instructions:
1. Mix salt into warm rice.
2. Prepare fillings.
3. Place rice on plastic wrap, add filling, then wrap.
4. Shape into a triangle.
5. Wrap with nori.
6. Serve.
